result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa M. Strohbusch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268 
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses uncharged referral DA Case#15JE6797 dov: 9-9-15 Disorderly Conduct (JEPD) and DA Case#15JE2451 dov: 10-1-15 (JEPD) Possession of Suboxone w/o prescription

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand 
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least 1x/mth for the first 3 months upon release from jail and then as deemed appropriate per agent)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or make legitimate efforts to obtain either, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid medical authority
--No possession of any hypodermic needle unless medically necessary
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Arresting Agency: JEPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

--To pay restitution & 10% processing surcharge on 15CF322 as to be determined at later restitution hearing

**4/22/2016 - --The Court orders that the Judgement in this case be amended to reflect the restitution amounts of $3084.78 owed to victim[Sonya Kopelke] and $1650.00 owed to US Bank
--The Court further orders the JOC be amended to include restitution owed to FCCU in the amount of $1205.000
--All of this is subject to the Defendant supplying the Court (by way of Attorney De La Rosa) with a letter acknowledging the amendments to the Judgement and further acknowledging from the Defendant her acceptance of this or these amendments to the Judgement. **

[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch 4]
Cases 16CF11 and 15CF322 called together at 3:16pm [mo]

--An Agreement as to restitution has been reached

Cases 15CF248, 15CF322, 15CM422 & 16CF11 called together at 9:51 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Melissa M. Strohbusch in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Ct#1-15CF248, Cts#1 & #2-15CF322 & Ct#1-15CM422; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts in each case
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses uncharged referral DA Case#15JE6797 dov: 9-9-15 Disorderly Conduct (JEPD) and DA Case#15JE2451 dov: 10-1-15 (JEPD) Possession of Suboxone w/o prescription

On Ct#1-15CF248, Cts#1 & #2-15CF322 & Ct#1-15CM422, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (15CF322)
--To pay $950 DNA Surcharge
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges (Ct#1-15CF322); to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least 1x/mth for the first 3 months upon release from jail and then as deemed appropriate per agent)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or make legitimate efforts to obtain either, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid medical authority
--No possession of any hypodermic needle unless medically necessary
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay costs of $1047 
--To pay restitution of $
444.67, payable to James Vorse (15CF248)

 (15CF248)
--To pay restitution & 10% processing surcharge on 15CF322 as to be determined at later restitution hearing

Cases 15CF248, 15CF322, and 15CM422, and 16CF11 called together at 12:54pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Melissa M. Strohbusch in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On the State's Motion for Bond Modification:
--Arguments given by Counsel

The Court denies the State's Motion for Bond Modification

As to Case 16CF11:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500  Signature Bond.
The Court does not order any non monetary conditions

recess: 1:01pm

NEXT:  As to All Cases Status Conference on 2/9/16 at 9:00am

Cases 15CF248, 15CF322 & 15CM422 called together at 8:56 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Melissa Marie Strohbusch in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Strohbusch waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty De La Rosa requests all matters be set for STC in January for calendaring purposes - are in negotiations. No formal pre-trial is needed.
DA Happ: Requests felony matters be set for jury as well following STC
Counsel agree case 15CF248 can be set for one day and case 15CF322 can be set for two days; Court informs parties that It will set matters on same date and
allow Judge Koschnick to determine which will proceed and allow matters to sever.
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 9:06 am

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) STC scheduled for 1/15/16 at 10:00 am - Send notices
15CF248 & 15CF322: (1) Schedule FSSC 2/9/16 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 2/15-16/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Defendant Melissa M. Strohbusch in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CM422(Initial Appearance occurs):

As to Cases 15CF322 and 15CF248:
Atty. De La Rosa gives the Court case updates
recess:10:22am 


NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing/Status Conference on 11/20/15 at 8:30am
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 10/5/15

Case called at 1:23 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Melissa Marie Strohbusch appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Miss Strohbusch is eligible for SPD Representation and informs the Court that she is also eligible on case 15CF248 which was heard earlier today

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia 
-No possession of needles
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No presence at 621 W. Plymouth St, Jefferson
-No presence at any pawn shops
-No selling of items on-line
-No use of credit credit cards or checks not in her own name
Recess: 1:27 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 10/14/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 10/30/15 at 10:00 am - Send notices
